which acts as an identifier for that value within the dictionary.

inlineContent.text: You can also use subscript syntax to retrieve a value from the dictionary for a particular key.

restricts access to parts of your code
from code in other source files and modules.
This feature enables you to hide the implementation details of your code,
and to specify a preferred interface through which that code can be accessed and used.
associate values with a particular class, structure, or enumeration.
Stored properties store constant and variable values as part of an instance,
whereas computed properties calculate (rather than store) a value.
Computed properties are provided by classes, structures, and enumerations.
Stored properties are provided only by classes and structures.
An
defines a common type for a group of related values
and enables you to work with those values in a type-safe way within your code.

de forma estruturada.
pode ser suspenso e retomado posteriormente,

permite que ele continue a progredir
em opera√ß√µes de curto prazo, como atualizar a interface do usu√°rio,
enquanto continua a trabalhar em opera√ß√µes de longa dura√ß√£o
como buscar dados pela rede ou analisar arquivos.
significa v√°rios peda√ßos de c√≥digo executando simultaneamente ‚Äî
por exemplo, um computador com um processador de quatro n√∫cleos
pode executar quatro peda√ßos de c√≥digo ao mesmo tempo,
com cada n√∫cleo realizando uma das tarefas.
Um programa que usa c√≥digo paralelo e ass√≠ncrono

suspende as opera√ß√µes que est√£o √† espera de um sistema externo,
e torna mais f√°cil escrever esse c√≥digo de maneira segura para a mem√≥ria (
Classes, structures, and enumerations can define

You use subscripts to set and retrieve values by index without needing
separate methods for setting and retrieval.
For example, you access elements in an

By default, Swift prevents unsafe behavior from happening in your code.
For example,
Swift ensures that variables are initialized before they‚Äôre used,
memory isn‚Äôt accessed after it‚Äôs been deallocated,
and array indices are checked for out-of-bounds errors.
is the process of preparing an instance of
a class, structure, or enumeration for use.
This process involves setting an initial value for each stored property on that instance
and performing any other setup or initialization that‚Äôs required
before the new instance is ready for use.
A class can
methods, properties, and other characteristics
from another class.
When one class inherits from another,
the inheriting class is known as a
and the class it inherits from is known as its
Inheritance is a fundamental behavior that differentiates classes
from other types in Swift.
are functions that are associated with a particular type.
Classes, structures, and enumerations can all define instance methods,
which encapsulate specific tasks and functionality for working with an instance of a given type.
Classes, structures, and enumerations can also define type methods,
which are associated with the type itself.
Type methods are similar to class methods in Objective-C.
are self-contained blocks of functionality
that can be passed around and used in your code.
Closures in Swift are similar to blocks in C and Objective-C
and to lambdas in other programming languages.
A
is called immediately before a class instance is deallocated.
You write deinitializers with the
keyword,
similar to how initializers are written with the
keyword.
Deinitializers are only available on class types.

Swift √© uma linguagem de programa√ß√£o para desenvolvimento de aplicativos iOS, macOS, watchOS e tvOS. Se voc√™ tem experi√™ncia em desenvolvimento em C ou Objective-C, muitas partes do Swift ser√£o familiares para voc√™.
Um operador √© um s√≠mbolo ou frase que voc√™ pode usar para verificar, mudar ou combinar valores.
Por exemplo, o operador de adi√ß√£o (
) soma dois n√∫meros,

A
defines a blueprint of
methods, properties, and other requirements
that suit a particular task or piece of functionality.
The protocol can then be
by a class, structure, or enumeration
to provide an actual implementation of those requirements.
Any type that satisfies the requirements of a protocol is said to
to that protocol.
A function or method with an opaque return type
hides its return value‚Äôs type information.
Instead of providing a concrete type as the function‚Äôs return type,
the return value is described in terms of the protocols it supports.
Hiding type information
is useful at boundaries between
a module and code that calls into the module,
because the underlying type of the return value can remain private.
Unlike returning a value whose type is a protocol type,
opaque types preserve type identity ‚Äî
the compiler has access to the type information,
but clients of the module don‚Äôt.
Swift uses
(ARC)
to track and manage your app‚Äôs memory usage.
In most cases, this means that memory management ‚Äújust works‚Äù in Swift,
and you don‚Äôt need to think about memory management yourself.
ARC automatically frees up the memory used by class instances
when those instances are no longer needed.
Swift provides a variety of control flow statements.
These include
loops to perform a task multiple times;
, and
statements
to execute different branches of code based on certain conditions;
and statements such as
and
to transfer the flow of execution to another point in your code.
e

s√£o constru√ß√µes flex√≠veis de prop√≥sito geral que se tornam os blocos de constru√ß√£o do c√≥digo do seu programa. Voc√™ define propriedades e m√©todos para adicionar funcionalidade √†s suas estruturas e classes usando a mesma sintaxe usada para definir constantes, vari√°veis e fun√ß√µes.
is the process of responding to
and recovering from error conditions in your program.
Swift provides first-class support for
throwing, catching, propagating, and manipulating
recoverable errors at runtime.
enables you to write flexible, reusable functions and types
that can work with any type, subject to requirements that you define.
You can write code that avoids duplication
and expresses its intent in a clear, abstracted manner.

adicionam novas funcionalidades a uma classe, estrutura, enumera√ß√£o ou tipo de protocolo existente. Isso inclui a capacidade de estender tipos para os quais voc√™ n√£o tem acesso ao c√≥digo-fonte original (conhecido como

are self-contained chunks of code that perform a specific task.
You give a function a name that identifies what it does,
and this name is used to ‚Äúcall‚Äù the function to perform its task when needed.
Enumera√ß√µes s√£o frequentemente criadas para dar suporte a uma funcionalidade especifica de uma classe ou estrutura.
